meanings.definition: To protect or guard someone as a bodyguard.
meanings.sent1: The security officer bodyguarded the VIP during the event.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was bodyguarded by trained professionals wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The penguin bodyguarded the fish in the aquarium, making sure no one stole them.
meanings.sent4: The fortress was bodyguarded by towering walls and vigilant soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The knight bodyguarded the princess, ready to defend her at any moment.

meanings.definition: To be protected or guarded by a bodyguard.
meanings.sent1: The president bodyguarded by secret service agents at all times.
meanings.sent2: The valuable painting was bodyguarded to prevent theft.
meanings.sent3: The cat bodyguarded by its loyal dog friend, always watching out for danger.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was bodyguarded by a shield of love and trust.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest bodyguarded by a fierce dragon, daring anyone to come near.
